name: Parasnath Hill
significance: Most revered Jain pilgrimage site; popular for trekking, nature exploration, and panoramic views.
history: Known as Shikharji, where 20 of the 24 Jain Tirthankaras attained Moksha, including Lord Parshvanatha. Ancient temples and shrines mark the summit.
culturalOverview: Hosts Jain pilgrimages and festivals like Paryushan & Mahavir Jayanti. Santhal tribes also revere it as sacred.
importance: Religious tourism, trekking, biodiversity hotspot, eco-tourism economy.

routes: Madhuban to Summit (9 km steep forest trek)
trekkingInformation.facilities: Dharamshalas, small eateries, guides available at Madhuban base

speciality: Blend of pilgrimage and adventure trekking with biodiversity and cultural harmony.
nearbyAttractions: Madhuban Village – base camp with temples

name: Netarhat
significance: Known as 'Queen of Chotanagpur', famous for sunrise/sunset views and British-era heritage.
history: Developed as a hill station during British rule; home to the historic Netarhat Residential School.
culturalOverview: Hosts cultural gatherings, educational tourism, and popular local festivals.

trekkingInformation.facilities: Government guest houses, private lodges, and local eateries available

speciality: Renowned for scenic sunrises and sunsets, cool weather, and tranquil landscapes.
nearbyAttractions: Lodh Falls – tallest waterfall in Jharkhand

name: Baidyanath Hill
significance: Famous for Baidyanath Dham temple, one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva.
history: Ancient Shiva temple over 1000 years old, mentioned in Hindu scriptures.
culturalOverview: Hosts huge pilgrimages during Shravan month, attracting millions of devotees.

trekkingInformation.facilities: Large temple complex, rest houses, local markets

speciality: Jyotirlinga temple with religious fairs and cultural vibrancy.

name: Tagore Hill
significance: Historic hill linked to Rabindranath Tagore’s family; ideal for city views and picnics.
history: Named after the Tagore family, it is said Rabindranath spent time here.
culturalOverview: Popular picnic spot, cultural gatherings, and meditation site.
speciality: Panoramic view of Ranchi city with historic charm.

name: Trikut Hill
significance: Known for its three distinct peaks and religious significance.
history: Mentioned in Hindu epics; ancient temples dot the area.
culturalOverview: Annual fairs and trekking events are held, drawing both pilgrims and adventurers.

routes: Trek to peaks through rocky terrain
trekkingInformation.facilities: Cable car, rest houses, shops near base

speciality: Unique tri-peak formation with both pilgrimage and trekking.

name: Dalma Hills
significance: Famous for Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary, elephants, and eco-tourism.
history: Known for tribal settlements and wildlife conservation efforts.
culturalOverview: Tribal culture and eco-tourism are prominent.

name: Rajmahal Hills
significance: Geologically ancient volcanic hills with rich history.
history: Formed from volcanic activity millions of years ago; important for fossils and geology.

trekkingInformation.facilities: Limited facilities, best with local guides

speciality: Unique volcanic formations and fossil-rich terrain.

name: Garhjat Hills
location: Border region of Jharkhand and Odisha
significance: Mineral-rich hills, known for trekking and nature tourism.
history: Historically important for mineral mining and tribal settlements.
culturalOverview: Tribal communities practice rich cultural traditions here.

trekkingInformation.facilities: Basic facilities; advisable to carry essentials

speciality: Mineral-rich terrain with cultural and trekking experiences.
